website_summaries.verdict: If you have a corner to spare in your garage or shed, this compact and affordable organizer offers out-of-the-way storage. However, we strongly recommend securing it to a wall to prevent tipping.
pros: Holds a considerable number of long handled gardening tools without taking up much floor space
Thick, sturdy plastic construction with wide base provides decent stability
Assembles in minutes, no tools required
Comes with precut holes for anchoring
cons: Unless it's anchored to a wall, it may tip over when fully loaded

customer_reviews.title: Fell on my brand new car!!!! Piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a couple of weeks, didn’t put a lot of weight in it. And now it’s fallkng forward Update: The day after I got my money back for this god awful product I walked out to find this thing falling over on my brand new 2017 Ford Mustang GT. So if you want scrapes and dents in you The day after I got my money back for this god awful product I walked out to find this thing falling over on my brand new 2017 Ford Mustang GT. I will let the pictures speak for themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I thought
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it didn't hold up very well. Once we added a Rake, Broom, Shovel and a few other items - it started to LEAN and has been leaning ever since. We're just waiting for it to fall over. Usually with Rubbermaid products there's an expectation the plastic is going to be somewhat flimsy, but still strong. In this case, I think they need to add a 'back brace-X-piece' so that the top part doesn't lean over
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lane

customer_reviews.title: Loaded Up, Good to Go.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. If you're concerned about it tipping over just shoot a screw into the underside of the top shelf and attach to the wall. It definitely looks better than it did. The other reviews are valid but in the end it's a rack that holds some brooms, shovels and other things. It doesn't need to be made out of titanium. If you need it, do it. Five pieces. You can put it together in less than a minute.
customer_reviews.author: NobleOne

customer_reviews.title: Width is Listed Incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: The packaging and info say the width is 37 inches. I bought it to put in a enclosed cabinet that is 37.25" wide. However, the product is actually 38" wide and therefore doesn't fit. I don't see how a company like Rubbermaid can make such a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Skip it, buy something less flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was originally excited about getting this to help free up some space in my garage and keep the tools organized. The first weekend I had it put together one of the wheels broke. The plastic base and supports are super flimsy, the wheel just pushed right through the plastic support and now the whole thing is twisted and lopsided... it no longer moves. I now have to take all the wheels off and use it as a stationary rack which defeats the purpose. I would but a much higher quality system. I have less equipment on mine than they show in the picture and it is just not strong enough.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rose

customer_reviews.title: It is not a sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these towers because I needed to organize two utility closets. Although the towers were easy to assemble, their positive attributes stopped at this point. Because the bottom poles are neither attached to the bottom shelf or weighted, they quickly pop out of their holes when items are added to the tower. This immediately causes the entire tower to sway or tilt. I am returning them both and will continue to search for a sturdier solution.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra R. Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive storage solution for your shed.
customer_reviews.text: This corner tool rack fits nicely into the corner of my shed and hold all the lawn tools that have been scattered willy-nilly for years. It has a low profile, so you have to make sure it is tight to the shed walls. I loaded it up with shovels, rakes, trimmers, brooms, pruners, thatchers, weed whips, etc and it is not showing any sign of tipping. It is smaller, so you may have to remove tools in the front to get to tools at the back. Pack the rack with this in mind. Set up was a breeze, it took about 30 seconds to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Larson

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews before you leap. The Rubbermaid Long-Handle Tool Storage Unit is good as long as you have adequate overhead room to lower the tools through the slots. You can get around this by only installing four of the eight vertical support tubes. This will kinda allow you to slide a tool on an angle and then lower it into the lower slot, There are really no easy provisions for storing anything with a D handle. I should have gone with the Rubbermaid Deluxe Tool Tower which can handle any kind of "handle".
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This One
customer_reviews.text: I usually like Rubbermaid brand items and thought this unit would be ideal for our yard tools. But it is just plastic, so lightweight and during the night, without provocation, the entire unit fell over in our garage. It was super easy to assemble but it is just so light and too low to the ground to adequately support the tools. And once assembled and placed, you can't move it without the entire unit coming apart, even without the tools inserted.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Cheap crap that is not supported by Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was missing castors and a post. Notified Amazon. They said return old one on my own money. The cheap $40 cart would cost $85 for me to ship back. That would be a total of $120 plus tax for this "cheap" cart. Throwing the old stuff in the trash winds up cheaper. However I still wound up paying $80 plus tax for this cart that is not really even worth the Initial $40 plus tax. In the long run it did save me money, because I am done with Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Bikingbob

customer_reviews.title: Works better when you glue it together
customer_reviews.text: No anchoring needed. I put two shovels a hard rake a soft rake, power head attachments and brooms. But my weight bench bars made it lose balance and fall apart. So, I glued it together and took the weight bars out. I recommend gluing it no matter what. It will keep its balance better if you glue it together.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary A McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Best one I’ve purchased so far
customer_reviews.text: This tool rack is great, I seen the other reviews which now I know are a little to harsh on product. It was easy to set up instructions are printed on back of the box. I currently have a leaf rake, bow rake, large push broom, small push broom, a square and scoop shovel. Personally that’s a lot of hand tools with weight. It does lean very very little but nothing to be dramatic about. It does seem small but that’s the point of storage and space saving right. But so far had it for a week it’s not mounted to the wall or anything, just standing alone and hasn’t fell over or broke.
customer_reviews.author: Art valenz

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY AT ALL WITH WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I have always thought of Rubbermaid as a company that made quality products but this one is NOT. This is not capable of handling anything besides a few very lightweight items. I didn't have many things on it all and went to move the unit and two of the casters snapped. The one star I gave it is only for the idea of what it should do. This product needs to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: WANT TO RETIRE

customer_reviews.title: Except it is hard to place items with large handles like hedge clippers
customer_reviews.text: It helps to hold a lot of our yard tools. Except it is hard to place items with large handles like hedge clippers. Also — we have it in our garage that has an 8.5 foot clearance. If we want to get to a rake, broom, or any tool out from the middle of the tool tower with a normal sized handle — we have roll the tool tower unit outside. Just something to think about if you plant to put this in a shed or a garage like ours.
customer_reviews.author: NW

customer_reviews.title: We bought this after we moved into our new home and it's awesome
customer_reviews.text: This yard tool organizer is awesome, we had all our tools leaning up against the wall in our garage, this solved that problem and totally organized our garage tools into one spot. I will upload some pictures, but this is totally worth the money, very sturdy, and so easy to put together. I would suggest to anyone looking to organize their garage this is vital to have, and makes all the yard tools nice and tidy. It a great deal at it's price as well and does exactly what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: LewisAK

customer_reviews.title: Okay for lighter tools
customer_reviews.text: I been using this for about 5 months without much complaints but its only had some lighter tools in it (rakes, brooms etc.). I purchased a new shovel and that was too much for this to handle. Came out today into my garage to see all my tools crashed over and hit my car that resulted with many nicks and scratches on my back bumper. Personally, wished I paid a little more for something more secure now. Can't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Quickly decreased clutter!
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning and reorganizing all the junk in the shed we've had and loaded up for 22+ years. Awful project! Shovels, rakes, sledge hammer, brooms--where to put all this stuff? Looked online for a solution and found this affordable rack. Ordered it and 2 days later, voila! Junk is all contained into one corner and it held everything I needed to put into it--leaf rake, garden rake, push broom, shovels, hoe, etc. etc. all the way down to the loppers and the plastic extensions for the ShopVac. Snapped it together in less than a minute. It is sturdy and stable and I plan to purchase another one for the garage at my summer home later this spring.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: It assembled easily and will do an OK job but it is ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit disapointed in this product. It assembled easily and will do an OK job but it is very flimsy. I had hoped to use this to hold all of the longer tools but a few heavy tools (digging bar, sledge hammer and the like) cause the tower to deflect. If your sole use will be for things like rakes and brooms it will serve fine; if you want something to consolidate all garden tools look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: SteveT

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, though the plastic is weak.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very simple to assemble, a great way to organize yard tools and looks good in the corner. Cons: Doesn’t retain its form. It’s been less than a week and the organizer is already leaning. I’m going to have to screw it to the wall. UPDATE: I’ve had to screw the organizer into the wall. I walked into my shed and all the tools were laying on the ground. This is is made of really cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Dude

customer_reviews.title: Almost But Not Quite Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This unit is almost perfect for storing long handle tools in a shed or garage. It holds quite a few items, doesn't take up a lot of space, and is better than hanging tools on the wall. However, I didn't realize that the holes in the bottom went all the way through. I would have preferred a solid bottom with cutouts so the tool handles were not setting on concrete and potentially exposed to water. If I had realized that I might not have bought it since I already had a set of shelves with wire racks that served the same purpose.
customer_reviews.author: The Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Fits nicely in a corner and holds a wide assortment of tools
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and doesn't have a tendency to tip over. Indents in the bottom piece for the handles is a nice touch - helps keep the tools upright. Can't store tools with large handles at the end - like some snow shovels, pitchforks, etc. have. I would have liked to have been able to store tools with large working ends (snow shovels for example) with the blade down.
customer_reviews.author: W Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: The base ridges are not enough to keep the implements from sliding around. Weedeater slid around all over the place. Just took it out and attached a hanger to wall for it. Works for shovels pretty well but lawn rakes not so much. Put them with tines up but handle would not stay put. They should have made it with deep divots for handles to sit in.
customer_reviews.author: Kuari and Pogo

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is weak and so are the wheels
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item a week ago. I set a few small hand held items in the holes a hammer, some gardening sheers. The plastic started to droop because of the weight and the legs started to bow out. I tried to pull it around my backyard which is flagstone and concrete. It kept getting stuck on the flagstone. The picture they show on here is exactly what it should be used for since it's made out of week material. Keep it on a smooth garage floor and don't think you can store small hand held tools on it cause it will weigh it down. My loss.
customer_reviews.author: sheena tiller

customer_reviews.title: Product not designed well. When you put tools in it falls over.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Product is not designed well. When you put the tools like the pictures show its gets top heavy and falls over. Mine fell on my car and scratched it. The 25.00 i threw out wound up costs me over 1000.00 to repaint my front bumper. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for organizing a garage
customer_reviews.text: I put this together pretty quickly. The directions, as i recall them, were heavy on illustrations and light on text so i made a mistake or two initially but it turned out perfect! It holds every outdoor tool we have, shovels rakes snowshovels, pruning equipment. and so on. and so easy to move when needed. best $40 we've spent for the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy

customer_reviews.title: Be very cautious what you use it for!
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to store a couple of shovels, rakes, brooms, hoes, etc.. ATTACH it to a wall or other solid surface. If not, it will possibly fall over. I bought this rack and the corner rack and they both nearly fell over onto a very expensive car. Physics is not in your favor here. The tool's weight is high in the rack and without more rigidity and weight at the bottom, over it will lean and finally fall
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Holds all of my tools
customer_reviews.text: This product does what I need it to. All the tool handles dont fit in the spaces provided and you have to figure out a way to make it fit. However, I love the vertical storage and it fits perfectly against my shed walls in that corner. I can also see all of them rather than them all being shoved in a cabinet type storage area where I couldnt see any of the tools. This is the solution I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: fyergoddess

customer_reviews.title: As excited as I can be... about a Rack of Yard Tools.
customer_reviews.text: When I got it, my first impression was that it wouldn't hold up. Plastic seemed flimsy, and I didn't think it would stand up to holding my shovels, rakes, picks, axe, etc etc. Actually though, it holds up very well. I've had it for about 6 months now, and have it packed with tools. It does the job. It saved me from making one myself out of wood... which would have been fun, but I have so many other projects going it would have been a waste of my time. Assembly was easy, and i literally have this thing packed with long handled tools. I do recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Campfield

customer_reviews.title: I Have to Admit I'm Surprised
customer_reviews.text: When I put it together it just didn't look like it would store enough product to make it worthwhile. I was wrong... kind of amazing how many items I was able to put in there. Also helped that there were a wide variety of holes so that even off-shaped items were able to find a home. It really is pretty impressive.
customer_reviews.author: BDS

customer_reviews.title: Good priced holder, but be aware
customer_reviews.text: Only negative for this product is weight capacity. This item can hold many things, but if these have some good weight to them, this tool carrier may begin to buckle/lean. So, I'm saying be fully aware of what you'll be placing in it. To fix the lean (even with floor level), I balanced out my weighted garden tools and riveted it to my shed wall.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Good product with a limitation
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product and serves its purpose well. The only issues that I have is you need to use in an area with high access above it. I am using it in my basement and because the tools have to be inserted through the enclosed hole on the upper level you need a lot clearance above to get something like a rake in the holder. Otherwise this is a nice holder.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: PHOTOGRAPHERS MUST BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for something to handle all the extra light stands, modeling chairs, sandbags, umbrellas, backdrop poles and Bogen arms for a long time now. When I saw this thing, a light went off and I realized I had found the perfectly solution AND IT HAS WHEELS. It's mostly used for storage and eliminates the need to hang everything on walls that in multiple locations all around my basement. It's really become a one stop shop for most things that involve my studio lighting and what I love the most is that I can roll it from my basement studio/storage place to my car and unload what I need there. Truly a professional photographer must have organizer!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a tool cart at a decent price that was described as NEW but returned due to a damaged box. I received the contents wrapped and like new. When I proceeded to place the 4th support leg on, I noticed that the base support leg receptacle had been crushed at the rim. Approximately 25% of the opening was effected. Bent it open for the most part with channel locks. The cart is a good bit crooked as a result. Nice cart otherwise for lighter long handled tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy JJ Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Organize made so easy
customer_reviews.text: I love this product my garden tools are so organized now and off the garage floor everyone should have this product and for that corner takes up no space at all love it
customer_reviews.author: darlene

customer_reviews.title: Be careful it doesn't tip over
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, however depending on the length of the handles on the tools you are storing, the unit can become very top-heavy and fall over. The holes and Slots provided are sometimes just a bit too small for some tools. None the less I was able to store everything I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: T0171

customer_reviews.title: Poor execution
customer_reviews.text: This is a good idea but executed poorly!!! Wheels way to small anything almost dust will stop it! It says holds 40 tools well maybe if they are all screw drivers but if loaded as pictured you will need to leave this in one spot and not try to move it. I have bought other Rubbermaid products in the past and have never been this disappointed. I have seen plastic packing heavier than these parts. Deluxe??? I could go on but as you can tell I would not buy again only keeping because packing was just as bad would be a mess to repack.
customer_reviews.author: Hank1946

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage Cart
customer_reviews.text: Love this storage cart. I love that it has casters and rolls easily. It has a lot of space to keep all the tools I have in an organized, accessible space. Made the garage corners where the tools were just leaning much cleaner and much less cluttered. I would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: amylis

customer_reviews.title: Good tool holder but had to mount it to a wall.
customer_reviews.text: This is a durable and versatile tool holder. I have just about every available holder filled. The only thing is that I had to screw it to a wall in order to keep it from tipping over. Other reviewers said the same thing, which is where I got the idea to screw or to the wall. I am definitely satisfied with it and would recommend it if you either only have a few tools or are willing to mount it to a wall. Maybe Rubbermaid could provide a mounting solution with it.
customer_reviews.author: ETA

customer_reviews.title: Such a smart organizer
customer_reviews.text: So Covid has me home and organizing and cleaning. The garage is my current project. This is the perfect caddy to store all the random tools. Very sturdy and so easy to assemble. Literally took me minutes to setup. It has wheels and is easy to move around in the garage. Wish we had this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: MT Pockets

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a durable, well designed product from ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a durable, well designed product from Rubbermaid and should serve me well for whats intended to do. The negative part was not with the product itself but that it came with only three legs. At first I opted to re-order it but when I went to UPS to ship it back, the charge was going to be almost Fifty ($50) bucks. So instead I went to Home Depot and but a piece of 1" PVC pipe, cut it down to the length of the fourth leg I need and it worked, so I'll just keep the unit now. It looks gerry-rigged but its serviceable.
customer_reviews.author: Augie M

customer_reviews.title: Get Control of Your Tools, Man!
customer_reviews.text: Great product but doesn't come with assembly instructions. Hint: The straight legs go in the FRONT; the curved legs in the BACK. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Billy K Richburg

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for organization.  Truly a space saver.
customer_reviews.text: This tool tower is lightweight, movable, and extremely easy to put together. Six pieces, three minutes, no tools required. Though it is light, it is sturdy and stable. I have just as many tools kept in the rack as the marketing picture on Amazon, and have no issues with entanglement or anything falling over. These tools had previously taken about ten feet of my garage wall to store, it is much more convenient to have them all consolidated into a much smaller space.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Best tool holder I found
customer_reviews.text: This was the best tool holder I could find for my garage to hold all my gardening tools in the summer and my shovels and scrapers for the winter. If I had room I'd get a second one so I wouldn't have to switch them out seasonally. But it's well worth it to get them all in one place and contained so neatly and they're are many more holes and places to pop tools in than any others that I have found. Very easy setup. Excellent price too!
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of tools! A++++
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was going to hold a lot of tools, but it holds more than I thought. Wow it is not small, but not too large either. Put together in minutes. Tough quality. On the bottom you can even put extra small tools if need be. Makes everything look super organized and easy to put tools away and keep all in one place. Will never be looking all around for a rake or shovel or even hand held garden tools. Love this! Highly recommend for someone whom is tired of clutter or walking buy and having your rake or shovel fall on you or tripping over it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great orgainzer
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a couple of weeks but initial impressions are very good. I have several shovels, sledge hammer and an ax (all blade down) and the rack still seems very stable. Definitely is saving me room in my shed. I can't use a couple of the holes in the middle of the rack because my shed is not tall enough for what i'd put there but I knew this was possible when I bought it. The front snaps/holders are great and so far seem pretty durable. I"ll update later if it does not hold up over the next few months but or now you can't beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Very Flimsy. The legs come off easy.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this product. I wish i could return it. Very flimsy and expensive for plastic junk. It doesn't hold well and the legs keep popping off. They don't clip or hold inside the black frame. DON'T BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Ted P.

customer_reviews.title: A lot of room for storage, seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of room for storage, seems sturdy. Does the job. I used this to store a lot of my garden tools and other tools as well. It has small holes as well as large ones, holes of different shapes and sizes, so that just about any tool can be stored on this rack.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Get organized!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad to receive this product. Great storage. My husband had things stored in the side of the house! It looked terrible. He didn’t have enough space so stuff seemed to be just thrown over there. I real junk pile, sore on the eyes! Not now!
customer_reviews.author: Shesalulu

customer_reviews.title: Toolbox for lawn tools hold a ton!
customer_reviews.text: Update: to flexible for intended use. Great design for cast aluminum. I would pay much mood for an aluminum version. Maybe I should use my old one to cast an aluminum version for myself...well the legs and the base pan. The top should be plastic. Fully loaded, it flexes, but still seems sturdy. Plastic means no rusting! This thing petty much organized my garage. Think of it as the toolbox for lawn tools. Things are actually easy to put back, this keeping my garage organized. Otherwise, I would have tools everywhere AND this rack. Not the case. Easy to implement.
customer_reviews.author: TerryTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how you could 40 tools in this, even if they're all skinny. Not sure if we're keeping as I'm not certain it will stay upright, especially with kids in and out of the garage. May see if my husband can attach it to the garage wall instead of attempting the return hassle. Undecided.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf3Crazies

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: The is a great tool storage tower. I did have an issue with one of the wheel holes not being drilled big enough for the wheel to snap into place, so I used a hair dryer to soften the plastic and popped it right in. Wheels move easily and smoothly in the garage which is amazing when you're moving and rearranging. It's very light and I have the sucker packed with tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B.

customer_reviews.title: Product Falls over rather easily
customer_reviews.text: This product stores a nice amount of tools in the corner of my garage. It is light and easy to install. The reason for less than a 5-star rating is that I have to place the tools in it extremely carefully, if the weight of them is not evenly distributed, it all falls over.
customer_reviews.author: GLarm

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and easy but not rigid enough for heavy use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and great capacity. However the design is very flimsy. While it is portable and the casters are okay the design is inadequately rigid for regular or heavy duty use. Small items and flat level surface would make a good use case for this.
customer_reviews.author: PulpComic

customer_reviews.title: Great in the garage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it is too hard to drill into the cinder block walls of the garage. it hold the tools and cleaning supplies nicely and compactly. anything that is too big would take up a number of the spots but that has not been an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Burton

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the garage organized and tools in plain view
customer_reviews.text: I like this because I can finally find all of my indoor and outdoor clean up. The pictures don't show it, but you can hang some things on the side too. Not certain if this would be good for really heavy implements, but for us, it does the trick. We are using it for brooms, mops, fan and ceiling dusters, regular garden shovels, and rakes. We also own some oversize dust pans that store nicely down below. I really like that this has wheels. Assembly is not that difficult, but you will need two sets of hands. My son and I put this together in about 15 minutes or less. It really helps keep the garage clutter to a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: SRKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much looks and works the way it says. Very simple assembly... if it takes more than 5 minutes to put this together, you have no business doing yard work. Would have given it 5 stars, but, while there are many difference sized holes, the ones in the front are a bit small for many of the tools I have stored in it and the spacing is a LITTLE tight, so I wouldn't expect to use all 40 tools unless you have some with narrow handles. Broom sticks, mops, rakes, etc. fit just fine in these holes, but heavy duty tools like tampers, axes, and some shovels will be hard to fit in some of the more convenient holes.
customer_reviews.author: George R. Cahlik

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY DUTY PLASTIC AND DOES NOT RUST
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these before and they do come in handy. Because I live in South Texas and they are exposed to hot temperatures, they usually start breaking down between 5 and 7 years have to be replaced. They are worth having for keeping the gardening equipment in order. Although I do highly recommend you anchor it (instructions are included) to a wall as heaver items like tall shovels or pick ax will cause it to lean forward. I would recommend it because it is heavy duty plastic and does not rust.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's plastic and comes in pieces, so I didn't expect it would be too strong. With less than half the storage holes filled with common tools like rakes, shovels and brooms, it leans and wobbles so much I have to lift items out very slowly and delicately to keep the whole thing from breaking apart. I am going to attach it to the wall with metal strapping and screws.
customer_reviews.author: shepherdess

customer_reviews.title: It falls apart if you touch it or even stare at it wrong
customer_reviews.text: We use this to hold tank brushes at our food manufacturing facility. We only have maybe 4 at any time in it and this thing falls apart all the time. Nothing fits just right. If you put something in the left side, it will slide all the way over to the right and then you are dealing with that. IF the floor had something better where it would hold the poles in place rather than the cheap little "stops" that it has, it would be much better. It still falls apart if you touch this thing though.
customer_reviews.author: Jon A

customer_reviews.title: Not stable with any weight on it.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have paid attention to the negative reviews. This thing is so unstable! If you put anything that has any weight on it don’t move it around or it will most likely collapse. Only good for really light weight tools.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Item
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across this, and ordered it for a Father's Day gift. This is fantastic! You can get a lot of items on it for storage, to help clean up the garage/shed. It fits nicely in the corner of the garage, and we can now have rakes, shovels, hoe, and numerous other miscellaneous tools all together in one neat little area.
customer_reviews.author: Lh

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy legs
customer_reviews.text: The legs for each corner come in two pieces. When you put them together, they are very flimsy ... If you put something heavy (like a string trimmer) on one of the ends, it can actually pull the thing over because the legs are so flimsy. Unless you can anchor this to a wall, I would pass on buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Loftus

customer_reviews.title: Brooms and dust mops only.
customer_reviews.text: If you're using it to store brooms and dust mops then this is probably OK. However if you wish to store garden tools like shovels and rakes then it is too flimsy and light weight. More than 2/3's of each implement is above the rack and the heavy end as well so it tends to wobble around. Maybe I have too many tools in it but no more than those shown in the picture and I still have lots of holes left to put more tools in.
customer_reviews.author: NJD

customer_reviews.title: Created more space in my shed
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great! Came in 4 pieces and super easy to assemble. Holes are wide enough to fit basic tools and sturdy enough to hold multiple in place without tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: Corrine Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: Kind of Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This holds a lot of garden tools. If you have a completely level concrete pad, and nothing that leans it may be perfect for you. However, it’s a bit flimsy and you can see in my photo it doesn’t have much structural rigidity.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: I was excited to get this but this is a complete fail in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a little bit and unfortunately it has not lived up to Rubbermaids name. It is sagging in the middle. On one side the supports are sliding out. I came out one day and it had completely fell apart. I had to take some tools out just to keep it from continuing to fall apart and what is the point of that? I don't have much in it a couple of rakes, shovels, brooms and and a pole or two. I was excited to get this but this is a complete fail in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: I am happy that I purchased this. It is simple to assemble and is made up of only a couple pieces. It does the job and it is a simple job. The plastic holds the tools in place and there are a lot of custom cut-outs for many different size tools.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Mako

customer_reviews.title: So much better than wall hanging my shovels and rakes
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these and when I moved my daughter begged me to keep the one I had. So replaced this. Keeps my rakes, shovels and other equipment handy and stable. Keeps my garage neat and tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Peters

customer_reviews.title: It's alright for light tools
customer_reviews.text: This product is alright. It has a ton of openings for many different yard tools, but I found after having it about half full that the legs could not withstand the weight and it began to lean to the side. I keep it in my garage next to my tall tool box, so it doesn't tip over, but I was kinda hoping it would've been easier to have filled and move around. I can't move it when it's close to full, it seems like it's just going to snap in half. If you don't have a lot of heavy tools (i.e. shovels, metal rakes, hoes, etc.) this would be a great product. Just not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: K. Green

customer_reviews.title: It is not stable when you put garden tools in
customer_reviews.text: It tilts easily when you remove one tool from the unit. All the holes on the bottom of the unit are hollow so they cannot hold the tools when the unit tilts as all the tools go through the holes and the unit collapse, which can hit the person standing next to it. I have to throw it away. I wasted money in buying a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed or happy with long term use
customer_reviews.text: Great little rack, but, it is now going in the trash pile as it is leaning forward and yard tools are in my way because the rack leans so bad, might as well just throw them back into the corner and dig threw for what I need
customer_reviews.author: Scott Savelkoul

customer_reviews.title: Helps organize your tools as the picture shows, just overpriced in my opinion...
customer_reviews.text: Works as the picture shows, and literally takes about 2 minutes to put together. The gray supports just pop in, and you put the wheels on the bottom. Zero tools needed. (The wheels can lock with caster type locks) Once you put it together though and it's over all too fast, you may think what I did....I just paid 40 dollars for this? Docked one star just because I think for six pieces of plastic and four wheels $40 is steep. But it does what it is intended to do, and that is organize your tools.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: SUPER NICE TOOL RACK!!
customer_reviews.text: Man, is this ever handy to get 'stuff' out of the way!!! I have so many mops, brooms, scrubbing tools, vacuum tools, garden tools, tool-tools. I purchased three of them. I can put my household tools in one, garden tools in another and then tools-tools and I love how they roll if you wish them to. What a great way to get mess off the floor and all those things that lean against the wall out of the way!
customer_reviews.author: Happy in Kentucky

customer_reviews.title: I love that it has a corresponding "pocket" for the end ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is well-made with multiple options for different shapes and sizes of handles. I am able to put my dogs' pooper scooper in one of the wider ones. I also am able to stand up my long level. I love that it has a corresponding "pocket" for the end of the broom handle on the bottom so the tools aren't slipping all over.
customer_reviews.author: Megan V

customer_reviews.title: Three parts missing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June and did not open the box until Sept. To my surprise, I found there was only one pole in the box. Three poles that are crucial to hold upper and bottom pieces together were missing. How could the company do this to their customer? I usually open box immediately and never had an issue. This is the only time i didn't open the box due to hot weather and did not want to do assembly in my garage. Now i missed the window period to return /replace the item. Very bad vender! They did not check.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Chen

customer_reviews.title: #AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This product made the organization into my lawn tools amazing. Very easy to put together and more importantly absolutely NO tools required. Sturdy, looks sharp, and even able to wheel around if ur not satisfied with the location. All in all, very happy with my purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Cheap, CHEAP! Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, cheap, CHEAP! Do not buy this junk! Yes the tools fit in there but it is as wobbly as it gets. You sure don’t want a kid to go anywhere near it. Quality has been cut to the point that it is chintzy junk!
customer_reviews.author: Scarsdale42

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be the most wonderful garage organizer. It was in the cold months. We live in South Dakota where the temperature has not reached 100 degrees yet this summer. The material the Rubbermaid Deluxe Tool Tower has softened and caused the tool tower to collapse. The tool tower has never been outsid of the garage which is closed except when cars go in and out. Extremely disappointed. What would happen to it if used in a hot region.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn B Drewitz

customer_reviews.title: Great Organizer
customer_reviews.text: I moved and don't have a shed anymore. This was the perfect organizer for the garage to keep things looking neat and orderly. It's heavy duty enough and on casters so it moves easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Organizing
customer_reviews.text: This tool rack has made my garage, soon to be she-shed, look much better. It is plastic as noted by other reviews but it is still sturdy. So far, I have about 10 or items (a shovel, broom, two rakes, shears, duster, a hoe, driveway brush, two swifter items, etc.) and it is not leaning or collapsing. It utilizes minimum space, which is good because my garage is very small. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenia

customer_reviews.title: It even holds my kayak paddles!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help organize my new garage before things got out of hand. When dealing with smaller spaces, wheels are always a bonus but I had no idea how much this would actually hold. My swiffer and small vacuum stay on here, my yard tools, edger, brooms, and my kayak paddles even snap into the round retainers on the back side with the paddles up in the air and out of the way of damage. I would definitely recommend this to someone looking for rolling organization for upright items, yard tools or otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: NOT quite as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Item not as pictured, posts that hold the 2 racks are 1/2 the size as described on the box, and in the amazon advertising. Item will work but works but if you are tall verdict is still out on how this works. I purchased to replace one that I had used for around 10 years, that had finally worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Craig H.

customer_reviews.title: Leaning after 1.5 year
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Deluxe Tool Tower with casters 1.5 year ago. During that time I would have given it 5 stars. But I just noticed it is leaning and not doing well, just like other reviewers have pointed out. It definitely has a short life.
customer_reviews.author: Heyo

customer_reviews.title: OUtstanding product, well designed
customer_reviews.text: really nice item, though a little more bulky than I expected from the picture. Very sturdy, though light in weight. Lots of holes of different sizes and shapes, arranged in a useful configuration. Bottom is textured so if you hang shovels facing down they don't slide off. The assembly is amazingly easy...I think it took me all of two minutes to snap the four pieces together and stick the wheels in their holes. No screws involved. Whoever designed this really thought about how it would be used..Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together (took me about 3 minutes and required no tools), super sturdy, and it's amazing the degree of order it immediately brought to our somewhat chaotic garage. A really cool additional benefit is now that my gardening tools are finally organized and so much more accessible, I actually feel inspired to do more gardening work and the yard is looking MUCH better for it. Big downside of the product is how stupid I feel for not getting an organizer like this earlier. :p
customer_reviews.author: UmitoYama

customer_reviews.title: Excellent yard and garden tool storage!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and plenty of room for all of your shovels, rakes, brooms, and other long handled tools you may have. It even comes with wheels and portable and not prone to tip. Very satisfied with this!
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Foster

customer_reviews.title: Easy Does It....Rubbermaid 5E28 Deluxe Tool Tower Rack with...
customer_reviews.text: It's wobbly and feels like it could fall apart when I move it (very carefully)to sweep the garage floor. I wasn't expecting much for the price but I was still disappointed when I opened the box and started snapping it together. When I pull a broom or rake out of it wobbles left to right. I don't keep any heavy tools in it and I didn't plan to use it for that, just brooms and a few leaf rakes so for me it's okay. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JimFromPA

customer_reviews.title: This thing is sturdy, easy to move and holds a lot of stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely perfect. It is quite able to handle everything that I had hanging around all over the place including an ask and sledge hammer. Now everything is in one spot and very easy to find. I couldn’t be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford C.

customer_reviews.title: Holds a Lot, But Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it, and it kinda works, but it's rather flimsy, and some openings are too large, while others are too tight. For example, it's hard to find a slip-in opening that will work for a standard broom, as they're a bit large. Yet a shovel has to be pressed in really tight to be gripped. The openings with movable "holders" are awfully stiff, and with the unit being rather flimsy, it's kinda hard to get them in and out. But it works, and holds a lot. It just won't take much abuse.
customer_reviews.author: RickR

customer_reviews.title: Storage Issues Solved!
customer_reviews.text: In a bind and short on storage space for all your tools? Let me highly recommend this great organizer. Having left my old one behind before our move to Branson West, MO and because the former owner took with him a wall mounted system they were supposed to leave, immediately went to several local box stores including Lowes and Home Depot. Sadly neither store carried this product. On line found that Amazon carried it and at a competitive price. Yeah! I now have all my tools and my wife's cleaning utensils all in a neat orderly organized storage unit. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: James Alan Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the corner of my tool shed
customer_reviews.text: I have the original plastic rubbermaid tool shed so I can't hang any tools. This fixed my problem and now I have great storage and organization of tools!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Chang

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to put together even for a 70 year old
customer_reviews.text: It was a breeze to put together. Love this because it holds so many essential tools needed for the home and garden. My sister has one and loves hers too.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Loy

customer_reviews.title: Needs stronger plastic and wheels!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it holds the tools and is well organized. I HATE that the plastic where the caster/wheels are held literally broke the second day we had it in use. Not sturdy enough for transporting items from the shed to the garden. I would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jaci W.

customer_reviews.title: Goes together in less than a minute!
customer_reviews.text: My teenage kids put this together in less than 2 minutes. They said it just snapped together; no screws were needed. The castors are very useful for us as the unit can be moved to different places in the garage. The only suggestion I have is why not give it some bright color options?! Yellow would be great. Make it an interesting focal point!!! ---
customer_reviews.author: craigery

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the rectangular version, but this triangular one is the current model. Nicely low to the ground, it’s easy to remove and insert tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mojave Narrows

customer_reviews.title: Awful design. Not strong enough.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what I expected from this. But it was awful. With half of my garden tools in here it was leaning so far I had to stop putting them in. I can’t imagine it being full with tools and trying to get one out either. It is just a bad design. This is going back.
customer_reviews.author: jarrett sabella

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: As it sits, as a standalone, it's not very sturdy. Perhaps if it were screwed into something it would be better. For the price, I would say look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: In My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't seem like much, but it holds a lot if you don't have the wall space for it. We keep it in the garage and it holds our various long armed tools like rakes, shovels, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Steven

customer_reviews.title: Slightly overpriced, still worthwhile
customer_reviews.text: I give this four stars because I think it's slightly overpriced. That said, you won't be disappointed if you decide to purchase. Assembly was super easy. The unit snapped together in two minutes. There are plenty of slots that let me store a variety of tools. All in all, this is a good solution for suburbanites with limited space in the garage. If you're looking for something to store long-handled tools *only*--i.e. rakes, shovels, brooms--I would recommend going with a wall mount instead.
customer_reviews.author: Droid1980

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store!
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this for my dad to use in his garage. He is always outside working and he can now easily stand up his rake, shovel, clippers etc. I love that it's on casters and can be moved around easily. It looks nice to have all tools put away and not just standing against the walls. This was a perfect storage solution for the work area and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: skrap21

product_meta.title: Rubbermaid 5A47 30 Tool Corner Tool Rack
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Corner Tool RackRubbermaid 30-Tool Corner Tool Rack (FG5A4700MICHR). Corner storage maximizes available space. Longer handle tool storage organizes 30 tools. Plastic construction is sturdy but lightweight and easy to move even when loaded. Easy to assemble without tools. The large, solid base provides stability, so it won't tip over even with large tools stored in it. Integrated holes in the top let you anchor the storage tower to the wall. Overall dimensions: 32 inches by 18 inches by 20 inches. For nearly 80 years, Rubbermaid has represented innovative, high-quality products that help simplify life. Recognized as a “Brand of the Century” for its impact on the American way of life.

AMAZON.COM
Organize up to 30 tools in any corner for more floor space, happier garages, and saner storage sheds with this corner tool rack from Rubbermaid. A large base offers plenty of stability for heavier shovels, rakes, and brooms. With no tools required for basic assembly, the rack also hooks easily to walls with any "S" hook (not included). This garden tool rack organizer is great for storing rakes, brooms, axes, sledge hammers, trowels, pruners, and more, the unit measures 32 by 18 by 20 inches (height by width by depth). Constructed of durable plastic resin, the rack will not rust, dent, rot or peel for years of reliable corner storage.
feature_bullets: Corner storage maximizes available space. Longer handle tool storage organizes 30 tools.
The garden tool rack organizer's plastic construction is sturdy but lightweight and easy to move even when loaded.
Easy to assemble without tools. The large, solid base provides stability, so it won't tip over even with large tools stored in it.
Integrated holes in the top let you anchor the storage tower to the wall.
Size: 19.4" D x 32" W x 20" H and 23.7" corner to corner. Made in the USA.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,127 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
